data.title: Good choice
data.text: Its a beautiful place to dinner and have some drinks! The dessert was amazing! The staff was super friendly and helpful. Definitely is a very special choice.

data.title: Terrific latin flavors at Cala on Fell st
data.text: this restaurant mirrors a similar one owned by the same lady in Mexico City.  its not what Americans think of as a "Mexican Restaurant"...but its latin/seafood/sauces/... all the great things you find in a great Mexico City restaurant.  Don't think tacos and enchilladas......think of whole fish, great ceviche, interesting sauces and flavors you'll want to try again.  To top it off...wonderful friendly service by all.

data.title: Best Mexican Food in SFO!
data.text:
I arrived early for brunch on a saturday so I had time to kill, but no worries, the amazing San Francisco City Hall is walking distance from Cala.
You walk into great interior design and ambience which sets a pretty good mood.
One I saw the menu I knew this was for real. I'm mexican... You just know. I instantly craved for chilaquiles and a nice beer. 
I have to say... Cala serves genuine mexican cuisine, and its probably the best I've ever had in the US.

data.title: Sampling San Francisco's new "hotspots"
data.text: Our foodie host, a Bay area resident was intrigued by the write-up of this new San Francisco eatery which is hyped as the best "Mexican restaurant in the States". I'll preface by saying that I have enjoyed sophisticated Mexican cuisine prepped by some fine chefs most of whom haled from Puebla in Mexico. Frankly, "Cala" was disappointing. The fish entree we shared was tasty but other dishes seemed contrived. I enjoy bone marrow by itself, so I agreed to try the baked sweet potato with marrow salsa. The "salsa" was unremarkable and its portion so small that it got lost on the potato servings (yes, I realize this is the punchline of a joke). At $19.00, this dish seriously failed to deliver. Our party all wondered about the decor and the wait staff were good but stretched a little thin which detracted from the experience. Of the meals we had while in the Bay area, this was the most expensive and the most disappointing. Having tried "Cala", I can't say I have any desire to return.

data.title: Not your ususal Mexican Food
data.text: This is a great place to try newly re-imagined Mexican food.  Servers are helpful and friendly.  Many choices of small plates and entrees - sea food is delicious.  Do not expect the Tex-Mex offerings in the usual Mexican restaurants.  This is sophisticated eating!

data.title: Probably the best Restaurant we went to in San Fran
data.text:
This is sort of a high-class and trendy Mexican style sea-food tapa bar. The food is really good, but the portions are not necessarily large. The service is excellent, but do reserve in advance, it will fill up. 

Communal sitting means a spot at a very large table of about 25 people, its sort of like sitting at the bar. There are also private tables, and actual bar seating. I found the bar seating to be the most fun, and great service from the bartenders.

data.title: Innovative Mexican gastronomy
data.text:
I really enjoyed my time at Cala as it is a very innovative Mexican restaurant. Don't expect to have traditional tacos or burritos in there. Cala use Mexican ingredients and create new dishes over them, completely different. The most amazing thing is that the different flavors match. 
The service is also good and attentive. Perhaps the only downside is the pricey wine list. But the restaurant has an amazing list of cocktails made with tequila and a good selection of craft beer. The restaurant is also well decorated and clean.
It's really worth going there.

data.title: pricey bites
data.text:
The food is very good but the small plate portions fall into the precious bites category.  it would probably take 6 items to really make a full meal, which will get you into the $200 range with wine or cocktails.  However, the grilled little gem salad is amazing.  The highly touted trout tostadas were good, not great. The marrow sauce for the sweet potato was reminiscent of unsalted Marmite, interesting but somehow not quite what I was expecting. we didn't get the fish but probably should have- it looked good.  
Service is excellent and the venue is industrial chic, like the rest of the hood.

data.title: Fantastic meal :-)
data.text:
My boyfriend and I LOVE eating out, and on a recent trip to San Fran we weren’t wowed by any of our well researched restaurant choices. That is, until the night came for us to go to Cala Mexican.  We booked online well in advance and were promptly seated when we arrived. The ambiance of the restaurant is perfect, a good mixture of busy with minimalist furniture and plants to give a bright and airy feel. 

The service was impeccable and the staff’s knowledge and passion for the menu was extremely impressive. We started our meal off with 2 of their signature cosmopolitans which were delicious and got us in the mood for some Mexican feasting. 

It was suggested to order a few small plates to share between us and after a detailed and very tempting explanation of each one, we really struggled to decide which ones we wanted. We were exceptionally happy with all of our choices, each one more delicious than the last. If you order just one thing make sure it’s the trout tostadas with chipotle, avocado and fried leeks. So fresh, and delicious. I’d travel back from London for just one more! 

Thanks for such a great meal, we’ll definitely be back next time we’re in SF.

data.title: Wonderful Dinner
data.text: We really enjoyed the food and ambience. Although it was noisey it had a friendly feel. The waiter was fabulous helping us decide what to eat. We ordered numerous items all of which were delicious.

data.title: Absolutely the best!
data.text: This restaurant has the best Mexican food I've ever tasted.  We had brunch with drinks, and everything we ordered was fresh, and delicious.  Tip is included in the pricing.

data.title: Fantastic!!
data.text:
We had dinner at Cala very soon after the New York Times article mentioned it as an exception to the current overpriced / underwhelming San Francisco restaurant scene.  An exception it certainly is!

The restaurant offers two large high-bar communal tables for walk-ins, plus about 20 regular (reservation-enabled) tables.  The night we dined there, it was packed, and deservedly so.  The room is bright, noisy and fun.  The bar offers a full variety of drinks, with a wide range of tequilas, particularly mescals, and the bartender is adept.  

If David is your waiter, count yourself lucky – he is absolutely wonderful.  He was attentive without hovering, friendly, very accommodating, and extremely knowledgeable.   

Cala’s food is designed to be shared with the table (sort of like tapas),  Every dish is earthy, well prepared, and beautifully presented.  With David’s guidance, we ordered six dishes for a party of four.  The first standout was the trout tostadas with chipotle, avocado and fried leeks.  The chipotle gave it a nice heat, and the avocado and leeks embellished both the flavor and the presentation.  The grilled oysters with squash blossoms and mushrooms was perfectly cooked and wonderful.  The other dishes were equally interesting and delicious.  We left full and happy.

data.title: Progressive restaurant but food wise a dissapointment
data.text: We had high hopes reading the reviews but  the evening didn't start well because despite a reservation we had to wait for at least twenty minutes before being seated. Staff were apologetic and friendly and offered some refreshments while we waited. The restaurant has a nice look and feel to it but we found the dishes too contrived and the combinations of flavors and textures not working.

data.title: Innovative, delicious high end mexican food
data.text:
We ate at Contramar in Mexico City and loved it.   We were happy to find their chef/owner now resides in San Francisco with a new restaurant, with a similar seafood theme.

The restaurant is popular and challenging to get into. The Resy on-line reservation system was very useful allowing us to not only see available spots but ask to be notified if a preferred time became available. It did and we jumped on the reservation.

Fair warning, SF is an expensive place to eat and this is high end food.  The atmosphere is bright and casual, but the prices are high, as to be expected, especially with seafood.

The food was excellent.  Trout tostadas were similar to the tuna version offered in DF and delicious.  The halibut ceviche with fennel and radish was delicate and tasty.

We heard a lot about the sweet potato and it was delicious.  It's a simple preparation - just a charred whole sweet potato, but the charred exterior lends a nice smokiness to the creamy interior.  It arrives with a bone marrow salsa negro which is just the right combination of spice and fat spread on a tortilla under the sweet potato. Yum!

We also shared the rockfish (for 2).  It was whole, butterflied and roasted then topped, divorciados-style, with a green salsa over one side and a red on the other.  It was mild but flavorful.

Overall the dishes were very flavorful with much less chile heat than we expected (or would have preferred.)

There is an extensive mezcal and tequila list with many top shelf, boutique options.  The mezcals were pricey and offered in two size pours.  Be clear on preferences.  My dinner partner assumed he has a small pour instead receiving the large, which we didnt figure out until the bill came.

Service needs some work.  Our server was lovely and well informed but the bar was quite slow in sending out drinks and our finished plates were left on the table long after they were empty resulting in an awkward dance when new food arrived with no room at the table. Some tweaking and the overall service would be great.

20% service is automatically added to the check.

Definitely worth a try.

data.title: Full to the Top
data.text:
We loved our long anticipated dinner at Cala. Our waiter was a pro, friendly as can be. The atmosphere is city hip. 
The food was delicious. We ordered five dishes and then split a dessert. The portions were so generous, more so than most 'small plate' restaurants,  that we probably had enough to have served four people. Sopes playeros - four on the plate, Masa croquetas - 6, mussels with carnitas over toast 4, a generous green salad and then a sweet potato with bone marrow the size of a small football.
Each dish was different and each delicious - were were happy campers when we left.
As a side note, they have a required service charge policy which is a 20% charge added onto the bill in place of tipping - there is no tip line on the bill. We learned that the fee is split evenly among the entire employee group - front and back of the house -and it enables the restaurant to provide health care for their employees. Since we tip at 20% anyway, this was fine with us and helps with providing a living wages for the employees.

data.title: one of the best meals ever
data.text: Somehow, even with the industrial look, the restaurant is not too noisy. I could actually hear my dining companions! Each bit we had to eat was inventive and delicious. My husband, who has quite a bit of food experience, thought it might be his best meal ever. I highly recommend Cala.

data.title: Amazing, innovative food
data.text: We had heard a lot of great things about Cala and found all of them to be true.  Impeccable service, we ordered 6 dishes and they paced the timing perfectly.  All the ingredients were fresh and the presentations were beautiful.  We had the trout tostadas which were served on top of a spicy chipotle sauce with avocado and topped with fried leeks.  Four tostadas with very generous toppings.  The squid and trout frito mixto was lightly breaded and very crisp, not soggy as frito mixtos sometimes are.  Another excellent choice was the grilled little gems.  They were served with corn tortillas and red beans.  The little gems had a slightly tart dressing which counter balanced nicely with the beans.  This dish could be a vegetarian main course.  Nice wine list with options of 1/2 and full carafes.  Very extensive mescal and tequila list.

data.title: Trendy and Pro
data.text: Some US friends invited me here... Really nice place with good food and good service. Highly recommended and it was fully booked by the way. Squids, Sweet Potato... Good.

data.title: Do Go☆☆☆☆☆
data.text: Fresh Take on many traditional dishes....Spectacular presentation & brilliant ingredients! White peaches & rainbow radishes+++...Oh & the Flan is AAmazing! The interior design is Lush & Open....a wall of plants trailing floor to ceiling & a live tree in dining area!Yep...we are Fans😚

data.title: Favulous
data.text: We had an incredible dinner at Cala. Inventive dishes, like sea urchin with a Mexican twist, and great service.  One of the best meals I've had in a very long time. Everything was outstanding.
